page.title: 01THE MINSTERWORTH AREA
page.content: The village of Minsterworth lies on the north bank of the River Severn some two miles west of Gloucester. The River is the main geographical feature of our block. Most of the land, which is flat and low lying, is used for farming, especially for cattle. The land near the River, like Minsterworth Ham, is liable to be flooded in winter. The main A48 Gloucester - Chepstow road crosses the block from north-east to south-west, as does the Midlands-South Wales Railway. The A40 Gloucester-Ross on Wye road crosses the northern edge of the block. Most of the houses are in the village of Minsterworth which lies along the A48, but there is also a small village at Churcham and houses at Elmore Back on the south bank of the R.Severn. There is a wood at Clay Hill; many of the houses have cider apple orchards.
